item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Alan Gurganus
item.description: "Writing means being a fascinated slave to current events." -- Alan Gurganus

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "A writer should always feel like he's in over his head" -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "If one publishes, then one is creating a public record of Learning to Write. " -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Tara L. Masih
item.description: "Being a doctor he didn't want for choices, but also being a doctor he understood the fragility of bone and sinew that encompassed the even more fragile organ of the heart. He envisioned Therese's as being wound in intricate, tight, vinelike veins that he would slowly make sense of and unravel." -- Tara L. Masih

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Kim Thúy
item.description: "If I had known what it meant to love, I wouldn't have had children, because once we love, we love forever, like Uncle Two's wife, Step-aunt Two, who can't stop loving her gambler son, the son who is burning up the family fortune like a pyromaniac." -- Kim Thúy

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Reinaldo Arenas
item.description: "All the literature of this century is somewhat burdened by the theme of uprootedness." -- Reinaldo Arenas
